content: The Apollo 17 astronauts brought back orange soil from the moon to which government service upon returning to Earth?

Upon their return to Earth, the Apollo 17 astronauts brought back the orange soil they discovered on the Moon to NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration). This unique orange soil was found at the Taurus-Littrow landing site and was later determined to be composed of tiny beads of volcanic glass, indicating that the Moon once had volcanic activity. The samples were carefully preserved and studied by scientists to gain insights into the Moon's geological history.
